front.title: Using the NETCONF Protocol over Transport Layer Security (TLS)

abstract.t: The Network Configuration Protocol (NETCONF) provides mechanisms to install, manipulate, and delete the configuration of network devices. This document describes how to use the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to secure the exchange of NETCONF messages. This revision of RFC 5539 documents the new message framing for NETCONF 1.1 and it obsoletes RFC 5539.
